  19. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  21. #include "caml/platform.h"
  22. #include "caml/frame_descriptors.h"
  23. #include "caml/major_gc.h" /* for caml_major_cycles_completed */
  24. #include "caml/memory.h"

  27. #include <stddef.h>

  29. /* Defined in code generated by ocamlopt */
  30. extern intnat * caml_frametable[];

  32. /* Note: [cur] is bound by this macro */
  33. ‌#define iter_list(list,cur) \
  34.   for (caml_frametable_list *cur = list; cur != NULL; cur = cur->next)

  36. ‌static frame_descr * next_frame_descr(frame_descr * d) {
  37.   unsigned char num_allocs = 0, *p;
  38.   CAMLassert(d->retaddr >= 4096);
  39.   if (!frame_return_to_C(d)) {
  40.     /* Skip to end of live_ofs */
  41.     p = (unsigned char*)&d->live_ofs[d->num_live];
  42.     /* Skip alloc_lengths if present */
  43.     if (frame_has_allocs(d)) {
  44.       num_allocs = *p;
  45.       p += num_allocs + 1;
  46.     }
  47.     /* Skip debug info if present */
  48.     if (frame_has_debug(d)) {
  49.       /* Align to 32 bits */
  50.       p = Align_to(p, uint32_t);
  51.       p += sizeof(uint32_t) * (frame_has_allocs(d) ? num_allocs : 1);
  52.     }
  53.     /* Align to word size */
  54.     p = Align_to(p, void*);
  55.     return ((frame_descr*) p);
  56.   } else {
  57.     /* This marks the top of an ML stack chunk. Skip over empty
  58.      * frame descriptor */
  59.     /* Skip to address of zero-sized live_ofs */
  60.     CAMLassert(d->num_live == 0);
  61.     p = (unsigned char*)&d->live_ofs[0];
  62.     /* Align to word size */
  63.     p = Align_to(p, void*);
  64.     return ((frame_descr*) p);
  65.   }
  66. }

  68. ‌static intnat count_descriptors(caml_frametable_list *list) {
  69.   intnat num_descr = 0;
  70.   iter_list(list,cur) {
  71.     num_descr += *((intnat*) cur->frametable);
  72.   }
  73.   return num_descr;
  74. }

  76. ‌static caml_frametable_list* frametables_list_tail(caml_frametable_list *list) {
  77.   caml_frametable_list *tail = NULL;
  78.   iter_list(list,cur) {
  79.     tail = cur;
  80.   }
  81.   return tail;
  82. }

  84. ‌static int capacity(caml_frame_descrs table) {
  85.   int capacity = table.mask + 1;
  86.   CAMLassert(capacity == 0 || Is_power_of_2(capacity));
  87.   return capacity;
  88. }

  90. ‌static void fill_hashtable(
  91.   caml_frame_descrs *table, caml_frametable_list *new_frametables)
  92. {
  93.   iter_list(new_frametables,cur) {
  94.     intnat * tbl = (intnat*) cur->frametable;
  95.     intnat len = *tbl;
  96.     frame_descr * d = (frame_descr *)(tbl + 1);
  97.     for (intnat j = 0; j < len; j++) {
  98.       uintnat h = Hash_retaddr(d->retaddr, table->mask);
  99.       while (table->descriptors[h] != NULL) {
  100.         h = (h+1) & table->mask;
  101.       }
  102.       table->descriptors[h] = d;
  103.       d = next_frame_descr(d);
  104.     }
  105.   }
  106. }

  108. ‌static void add_frame_descriptors(
  109.   caml_frame_descrs *table,
  110.   caml_frametable_list *new_frametables)
  111. {
  112.   CAMLassert(new_frametables != NULL);

  114.   caml_frametable_list *tail = frametables_list_tail(new_frametables);
  115.   intnat increase = count_descriptors(new_frametables);
  116.   intnat tblsize = capacity(*table);

  118.   /* The size of the hashtable is a power of 2 that must remain
  119.      greater or equal to 2 times the number of descriptors. */

  121.   /* Reallocate the caml_frame_descriptor table if it is too small */
  122.   if(tblsize < (table->num_descr + increase) * 2) {

  124.     /* Merge both lists */
  125.     tail->next = table->frametables;
  126.     table->frametables = NULL;

  128.     /* [num_descr] can be less than [num_descr + increase] if frame
  129.        tables were unregistered */
  130.     intnat num_descr = count_descriptors(new_frametables);

  132.     tblsize = 4;
  133.     while (tblsize < 2 * num_descr) tblsize *= 2;

  135.     table->num_descr = num_descr;
  136.     table->mask = tblsize - 1;

  138.     if (table->descriptors != NULL) caml_stat_free(table->descriptors);
  139.     table->descriptors =
  140.       (frame_descr **) caml_stat_calloc_noexc(tblsize, sizeof(frame_descr *));
  141.     if (table->descriptors == NULL) caml_raise_out_of_memory();

  143.     fill_hashtable(table, new_frametables);
  144.   } else {
  145.     table->num_descr += increase;
  146.     fill_hashtable(table, new_frametables);
  147.     tail->next = table->frametables;
  148.   }

  150.   table->frametables = new_frametables;
  151. }

  153. /* protected by STW sections */
  154. ‌static caml_frame_descrs current_frame_descrs = { 0, -1, NULL, NULL };

  156. ‌static caml_frametable_list *cons(
  157.   intnat *frametable, caml_frametable_list *tl)
  158. {
  159.   caml_frametable_list *li = caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(caml_frametable_list));
  160.   li->frametable = frametable;
  161.   li->next = tl;
  162.   return li;
  163. }

  165. ‌void caml_init_frame_descriptors(void)
  166. {
  167.   caml_frametable_list *frametables = NULL;
  168.   for (int i = 0; caml_frametable[i] != 0; i++)
  169.     frametables = cons(caml_frametable[i], frametables);

  171.   /* `init_frame_descriptors` is called from `init_gc`, before
  172.      any mutator can run. We can mutate [current_frame_descrs]
  173.      at will. */
  174.   add_frame_descriptors(&current_frame_descrs, frametables);
  175. }


  178. ‌typedef struct frametable_array {
  179.   void **table;
  180.   int ntables;
  181. ‌} frametable_array;

  183. ‌static void register_frametables(frametable_array *array)
  184. {
  185.   caml_frametable_list *new_frametables = NULL;
  186.   for (int i = 0; i < array->ntables; i++)
  187.     new_frametables = cons((intnat*)array->table[i], new_frametables);

  189.   add_frame_descriptors(&current_frame_descrs, new_frametables);
  190. }

  192. ‌static void stw_register_frametables(
  193.     caml_domain_state* domain,
  194.     void* frametables,
  195.     int participating_count,
  196.     caml_domain_state** participating)
  197. {
  198.   barrier_status b = caml_global_barrier_begin ();

  200.   if (caml_global_barrier_is_final(b)) {
  201.     register_frametables((frametable_array*) frametables);
  202.   }

  204.   caml_global_barrier_end(b);
  205. }

  207. ‌void caml_register_frametables(void **table, int ntables) {
  208.   struct frametable_array frametables = { table, ntables };
  209.   do {} while (!caml_try_run_on_all_domains(
  210.                  &stw_register_frametables, &frametables, 0));
  211. }

  213. ‌caml_frame_descrs caml_get_frame_descrs(void)
  214. {
  215.   return current_frame_descrs;
  216. }

  218. ‌frame_descr* caml_find_frame_descr(caml_frame_descrs fds, uintnat pc)
  219. {
  220.   frame_descr * d;
  221.   uintnat h;

  223.   h = Hash_retaddr(pc, fds.mask);
  224.   while (1) {
  225.     d = fds.descriptors[h];
  226.     if (d == 0) return NULL; /* can happen if some code compiled without -g */
  227.     if (d->retaddr == pc) break;
  228.     h = (h+1) & fds.mask;
  229.   }
  230.   return d;
  231. }
